If an upload gets more than about 300 views within a certain time limit, Youtube stops the counter rising and does a few checks to make sure the video's legit.  Then they add them all a few hours later if it has passed all the tests.  This doesn't happen for the like button.

Depends what size the original artwork is, assuming you've still got it. If you can scan it at a good resolution you can create it at pretty much any reasonable size. Take it to a decent scanning machine. Kinkos can do it, but I have heard mixed reviews about their quality. Since it is good art you may want to take it to a local professional scanner. so according to Einstein's theory of relativity and the theory of mass and energy, E=MC2, a cats flip has nothing to do with physics, but it has everything to do with training your cat and giving him or her some treats.

To train my cats to not do this I got into the habit of kicking them very gently out of the way.  More of a push to the side with the top of my foot than an actual kick.  This blew up in my face when my firstborn was first crawling and guess what I was in the habit of doing.
Can we get the physics of cats tripping humans after this?      8^)

I don't think it is possible for there to be contra-rotation on landing.  Assuming zero angular momentum at the start, there has to be zero angular momentum at landing. So as long as the cat is not actively twisting itself or moving its appendages, it will not be rotating (as a whole) when it hits the ground.

We saw this principle with flying scooters: the driven wheel, which is connected the the rigid body can be revved up of braking applied, so changing its angular momentum (and thus the angular momentum of the rest of the bike - no violations entailed)

So the cat can spin up its tail (via muscles) to give its body and opposite angular momentum and bring about the turning need to land feet first.

(and I assume it also has to use its muscles on landing to 'kill' or dampen that contra rotation?
